text: Alan MacGregor Cranston (June 19, 1914 - December 31, 2000) was an American politician and journalist. He was the United States senator of California. He served as senator from 1969 to 1993. He was a member of the Democratic Party. Cranston ran for President of the United States in 1984, but lost the Democratic Party primary to Walter Mondale. Cranston died in Los Altos, California from natural causes, aged 86. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Journalists from California Category:People from Palo Alto, California Category:1984 United States presidential candidates Category:United States senators from California Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:20th-century American politicians Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Stanford University alumni
title: Alan Cranston
